It uses Suspense for loading handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-fiber/blob/master/docs/tutorials/v9-migration-guide.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { GLTFLoader } from 'three/addons' import { useLoader } from '@react-three/fiber' function Model() { const gltf = useLoader(GLTFLoader, '/path/to/model.glb') // ... } // or, const loader = new GLTFLoader() function Model() { const gltf = useLoader(loader, '/path/to/model.glb') // ... } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Animating Object Rotation with useFrame in React Three Fiber DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to animate a mesh's rotation property using the elapsed time from the clock. SOURCE: https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-fiber/blob/master/docs/tutorials/basic-animations.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` useFrame(({ clock }) => { myMesh.current.rotation.x = clock.elapsedTime }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: React Three Fiber with TypeScript DESCRIPTION: TypeScript implementation of the 3D box example using React Three Fiber. SOURCE: https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-fiber/blob/master/docs/advanced/scaling-performance.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` function Instances({ count = 100000, temp = new THREE.Object3D() }) { const instancedMeshRef = useRef() useEffect(() => { // Set positions for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) { temp.position.set(Math.random(), Math.random(), Math.random()) temp.updateMatrix() instancedMeshRef.current.setMatrixAt(i, temp.matrix) } // Update the instance instancedMeshRef.current.instanceMatrix.needsUpdate = true }, []) return ( ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declarative Object Properties in React Three Fiber (JSX) DESCRIPTION: The recommended declarative approach for creating a Three.js mesh with nested components for geometry and material. SOURCE: https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-fiber/blob/master/docs/tutorials/loading-textures.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` const [colorMap, displacementMap, normalMap, roughnessMap, aoMap] = useLoader(TextureLoader, [ 'PavingStones092_1K_Color.jpg', 'PavingStones092_1K_Displacement.jpg', 'PavingStones092_1K_Normal.jpg', 'PavingStones092_1K_Roughness.jpg', 'PavingStones092_1K_AmbientOcclusion.jpg', ]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: GLTF Model Loading with Resource Caching DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement efficient model loading using useLoader with automatic resource caching for GLTF assets.
